sense.name: send away, expel
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare to sense 2. This is a more general sense and does not include banishing thoughts, emotions, etc. Notice that while Sense 1 NP2 is concrete, Sense 2 NP2 is abstract. Syntax Is: NP1[agent] BANISH NP2[patient[animate]] (PP NP3)
sense.examples: The Sultan of Turkey then banished Him to the prison of 'Akka in Syria. Ozai burned his face and banished him from his country when he thought the boy was disrespecting him. Higham was confronted by team owners who banished him from professional baseball. We have cast God behind our backs, expelled Him from school, and banished Him from the school yard.

sense.name: Get rid of an emotion, situation, or abstract influence.
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare to sense 1. This is a subsense of sense 1 that only includes banishing thoughts, emotions, etc. Notice that NP2 in Sense 2 is ABSTRACT. Syntax Is: NP1[agent] BANISH NP2[patient[abstract]]
sense.examples: I banished the thought as, moments later, my honey and I squeezed closer to each other at the picnic table and raised our glasses for our first toast. Their pleasure banished the anger from King Frost's heart. Her eyes teared up, but she stuck her chin out and banished the sorrow. Indeed, the two leading ladies have banished competition.
